nodes.bodyText: Care to give an example?  (What does a Version-id look like)
What's a good example to give when it's just a UUID that the API generates for you? Should I just add "-uuid?"
You can just say, provided by the API.  (It didn't appear typed, perhaps it should be)
Should this be public since it's guiding the input?
This is modeled after all the other samples, so for consistency I'd prefer not to have just this one be different. It's more just an in-sample reference for how the path is structured.

Yes - but this string isn't a useful thing to pass, ideally, you'd have a builder in the client lib for the string, the next level would be to publish that string in the client lib, and short of that do so in the sample so that it can be used in other places.
Should the v1beta1 be defined near the top in all caps so users could easily change it?
Are users meant to copy this code directly? I always advocated for making this code as copy-pastable as possible, but it seemed like the sample format didn't go in that direction.
Why do we need to set this?
I believe I set this at one point because the calls were hanging for long periods of time, and I needed the tests to fail and not hang indefinitely if the call wasn't being returned.
This is fine for tests, but in samples, I'd prefer we used json objects using Guava's GSON, Jackson, or org.json JAVA-Json
